item.title: Tokio Marine Life Insurance Singapore enhances chatbot with recruitment features
item.description:
Source: TMLS website. The TOMI avatar. Tokio Marine Life Insurance Singapore (TMLS), the only Japanese life insurer in Singapore, has introduced a recruitment feature to its chatbot, TOMI (Tokio Marine Insurance). This addition makes TOMI the first chatbot in Singapore to assist an insurer’s recruitment process, further enhancing its role as Singapore’s first self-learning AI chatbot designed to increase public access to life insurance. With the goal of engaging today’s tech-savvy generation in the recruitment process, TOMI is now equipped to answer over 300 questions about becoming a financial advisor...

item.title: Discover the surrounding areas of Hotel Indigo in the new Neighbourhood 15 campaign
item.description:
Hotel Indigo’s new brand campaign, “Neighbourhood 15,” highlights the unique character of each hotel’s surrounding area, specifically within a 15-minute radius. The campaign showcases local businesses and individuals who contribute to the neighborhood’s vibrant atmosphere. A two-minute video featuring the Hotel Indigo Bali Seminyak Beach, the brand’s first resort location, introduces viewers to nearby attractions like Surf School Bali, Divine Earth restaurant, and Bali Barber. Starting in October, a series of videos will delve deeper into these local businesses, offering insights and personal stories...

item.title: The desired features in chatbots according to Amdocs
item.description:
A recent study focusing on artificial intelligence (AI) spending in major communications and media companies across the Americas, Europe, and Asia reveals that the anticipated increase in AI-powered customer service might be hindered by misguided investments and a shortage of skilled personnel. This research, commissioned by Amdocs and conducted by Forrester Consulting, surveyed over 2,500 individuals, including CEOs, senior decision-makers, and consumers.
